UserPrompt(content='What are the components I can use in streamlit to make a chatbot ui?', timestamp=datetime.datetime(2025, 1, 1, 20, 56, 43, 146826, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), role='user')

ModelTextResponse(content='To create a Chatbot UI using Streamlit, you can utilize the following components and tools:

1. **Text Input**: This component allows users to type their queries or messages to the chatbot. This can be implemented using `st.text_input()`.

2. **Button**: To submit the user input from the text input field, you can use a button component. This can be added using `st.button()`.

3. **Messages Display**: Display the chat messages in a structured format. This can be done by appending each new message to a list and using `st.write()` or custom components like `st.chat` which are specifically designed for chat interfaces.

4. **Session State**: Use Streamlit’s session state to maintain the chat history across multiple user interactions. This helps in persistently storing previous chat data, which can be displayed in the chat window.

5. **Markdown or HTML**: To format the chat messages, you can use `st.markdown()` or `st.html()` for more complex formatting needs.

6. **Custom Streamlit Components**: There are custom Streamlit components like [st-chat](https://github.com/AI-Yash/st-chat) which are designed specifically for chatbot interfaces, allowing for more advanced features and styling.

For a detailed tutorial on building a chatbot with Streamlit, you can refer to the [Streamlit Docs](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/tutorials/llms/build-conversational-apps) or explore examples like the one using LlamaIndex and OpenAI on [Medium](https://medium.com/@pritubera/building-a-streamlit-chatbot-for-technical-questions-with-llamaindex-and-openai-26808c841dab).

### Sources:
- [GitHub - AI-Yash/st-chat](https://github.com/AI-Yash/st-chat)
- [Streamlit Docs: Build a basic LLM chat app](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/tutorials/llms/build-conversational-apps)
- [Medium Article on Building a Streamlit Chatbot](https://medium.com/@pritubera/building-a-streamlit-chatbot-for-technical-questions-with-llamaindex-and-openai-26808c841dab)', timestamp=datetime.datetime(2025, 1, 1, 20, 56, 54, 755032, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), role='model-text-response')

ModelTextResponse(content="It looks like you're testing the system! If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.", timestamp=datetime.datetime(2025, 1, 1, 20, 57, 53, 957966, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), role='model-text-response')
